Overall I would say this place deserves 3.5 stars, but that's not an option, so I will be kind and give it 4 stars.

I have been looking for a good mexican takeout place, and this one is great!
Had the chips and salsa and a chicken flauta, both were fantastic! :)
Great price for the amount of food you get. Also, it taste great! Good location for all the nearby clubs and bars nearby.

This a local favourite and the food is pretty darn good.
We ate in this time - there was 5 of us and the restaurant wasn't busy.
The food servings are pretty decent and the service is always friendly.
It has a strong 'to go' service so it's pot luck on whether you get it on a busy or quiet period - but the service is fast and efficient.
Tastes are great, they have a super good menu with lots of choices and a variety of beers.
This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant.  The cheese enchiladas are better than anywhere in the valley. Chinos, tacos and many good choices!

Delicious and a great value!

Every time I crave Mexican food, I go here!  I typically share the 3 Item Combo for $9.95 and it's always perfect!  Whether we order the green corn tamale, chicken taco, bean tostada, enchilada, it's all great!  Chips and Salsa are tasty too!  Enjoy!

We had lunch here not too long ago on recommendation. Though the servings were HUGE, I personally didn't like my quesadilla as it was a greasy, nasty mess. Also the chicken tasted as though it can out of a can.  Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food though....so maybe it was just me! :O)

Just crappy Mexican food the best part was the Mexican flag in my food. But this a disgrace to Mexico in every way possible. Every single menu item taste the same.  The salsa is watery and nasty. Don't waste your time.

YUMMMMM!   Very convenient little place. The food isn't like gourmet best Mexican food but it's still really good. I love the chicken flautas and chips and salsa. The rice and beans suck but who cares.

The big Julio's is closed and transformed into a breakfast place but I am so happy that Julio's Too has survived. Good, cheap, Mexican food. Two people could easily split a combo for a super-cheap lunch. Their take out is fast or there is a small seating area inside the restaurant. Or, to pick up dinner on the way home you can call ahead and have it waiting for you. I love that they serve beer bottles to go!

When I entered this place I was confused if they were open or not. I had to walk around to find a server. I only stayed because I was meeting friends for brunch. The server was nice but messed up everyone's order. 
I won't even get started on the disappointment in the food.

Soooo good! Chicken tacos and cheese enchiladas are the best!  Their staff is so friendly and the chips and salsa (get the hot!) are yummy! When we ate here they were playing an 80's station too - perfect!

Short and sweet....

-Close to work
-Lunch Specials
-Pollo Magnifico
-Mini Chimis w. jalapeno cream cheese

The end!  :D
Great food, fast friendly service. If I'm area try for lunch and sit in beautiful outdoor seating area. Right outside Old Town so perfect place to relax with good food.

I had the Lunch Pollo Magnifico, yummy as always! Nice and crispy tortilla with delicious jalape√±o cream cheese. The absolute best hot sauce and guacamole with the chips. This is a huge portion so I'm lucky enough to have it again today!

Been coming here for lunch with business associates for a number of years.  The staff is always friendly and courteous.  The prices are very reasonable with nice sized portions.  I usually get a two item combo for lunch and it's plenty of food.  It's not fast food, but your order comes out pretty quickly.  The food is authentic Mexican and I think it's a really good meal.

I went into Julio's yesterday for lunch.  Didn't start with a good impression at all.  When I ordered my margarita I was asked for my ID.  Understandable.  I've worked in the restaurant industry for 10+ years, I get it.  But I didn't even get a smile, or even eye contact.  I then stood there for about 5 minutes while the employees passed around my out-of-state license (I just moved here a few months ago, and I'm 24, btw).  I found this pretty unprofessional.  The older blonde was cashing me out and piled on the attitude.  If she had rolled her eyes one more time, I'm pretty sure they'd roll right out of her head.  The younger gentleman who brought out my burrito put the food down and walked away... that's it.  

My point is... if you like food, you miiiiiight like this place, it was mediocre.  If you like good service, don't waste your time.  If I was the owner of this restaurant, I would be embarrassed to employ these people.  They were rude, condescending, and pretenscious.  

I had the spinach and chicken burrito.  It was meh.  The margarita was great, but came in a plastic cup... pretty anticlimactic and non-environamentally friendly.  BOOOOOOO!

I have nothing but great things to say. I first came here for lunch with work friends and was thrilled to have lots of vegetarian options. I am a vegetarian, but I LOVE Mexican food, cheese, loads of veggies and spicy food. They managed to meet all those needs and then some.

In addition, the people are so polite! I've had great customer service every time I've come and they even sent me away with some complimentary chips and salsa last time... and I didn't even buy an entree (Just chips and salsa for someone else). 

The quesadillas are the size of the moon, so there's that, too. We will be back again and again. So delicious.

Tip: It's a small place, so to-go is a great option!

I've been to the majority of the big name taco shops in the valley  and man this place kills them all. Everything is very fresh, taco shells are magnificent, chips and salsa were perfect, and it's a very friendly place. 

They have a frozen take home selection which I think I'll take advantage of next time, because those frozen tamales were massive and looked delicious. 

I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick lunch or just craving for a quick Mexican fix, it's amazing!

First time here! To-go on a Sunday so I expected it wouldn't be quick and it wasn't. The food was excellent and that is what matters MOST for me. I have been searching for the chimi app that came with the cream cheese for a while. I wasn't disappointed! They were crispy and cooked perfect.  The jalape√±o cream cheese was what I was craving.  Since it was my first time, thought I'd play it safe with enchiladas. I ordered the 2 items with rice n beans. I chose the chicken enchi and beef enchi. I was impressed!  The sauce was what I was hoping for. I'm glad I found this place. I don't see myself eating here in the heat of Summer but I can definitely see myself getting it to-go. I will definitely be back!

TERRIBLE service. I've never had a Mexican food restaurant be sooooo stingy with salsa and so rude. Even the manager was terrible when it came to customer service. You are in the business of serving food and making it an enjoyable dining experience for your customers. When we purchase a pint of salsa because we know you are stingy with your salsa, that doesn't revoke the customers right to salsa with their large meal they just paid for. I can only assume you're being so stingy because your business is doing so poorly. Why don't you consider improving your customer service for starters.

Very good little take-out, diner specializing in Mexican fare.  The prices are reasonable and the food is delicious!  The serving sizes are also large so plan on leftovers.  They bring ample chips & salsa and while the salsa is not the best I've had, the chips are warm and I assume made in-house.  
I get the Carnitas (pork) which is about $12 for the dinner

A great place to get some excellent Mexican food in a casual setting.  You order at the counter and the food is delivered to you table.  We had lunch there on a Saturday and the place was hopping.  Excellent food and service.  You will not be disappointed.

After spending the day with my friend Austin, we were starving and came here for lunch.  I've never been here before, and or my first time, I have to say it was pretty darn good.

Upon entering, there's two Julios....we went to the smaller one that seems to be more of a fast casual type setting....self serve nachos, fountian pop, and you place your order at the counter.  The other julios is more of a sit down resturant with servers...we wanted a more casual dining experience, so we kept it to Julio toos.

I went with the Burro enchilada with shredded beef, rice and refried beans.  Prices here were awesome, and I got a ton of food.  Austin went with the mini chimi's, and I tried a few and they were tasty!!!  yummy.

I have enough leftovers for dinner, and was quite full after finishing my meal here at lunch time.   Place is small, well decorated, has an outdoor patio and a wide variety of menu items to choose from.

  Will be back in the future for more.

They are always tip notch. Great food and awesome service! They go above and beyond always with bringing food to your table, giving extra chips and salsa when you need. I love the pollo magnefico! It's amazing! Chicken chimichanga with jalape√±o cream cheese and shredded cheese on top. Also love that they have orange blossom beer. Come here! You won't regret it.

While I don't quite agree with everything Colin S has to say he essentially sums up Julio's Too. It's horrible. I ordered the veggie burrito, now you don't have to. It is disgusting. Don't bother with the salsa, It comes from a jar. You would have to be really wasted to actually eat here and think it is anything but hideous. Colin S is also correct on the parking. The lot was full but there was no one in the restaurant. One of the worst Mexican restaurants I have had the misfortune of dining at.

Fantastic take out Mexican food! 

Whenever we want quick and quality take out Mexican food we come here. They have delicious food, friendly service, reasonable prices, and healthy portion sizes. 

Everything on the menu is good, but my favorites are the mini chimis (cream cheese sauce is amazing), pork green chili, shredded beef tacos, flautas, and their chimichangas (oh...they are giant and glorious)!  They also have old fashioned sodas, beer, and margaritas to go along with your chips and salsa. Their salsas are excellent, and if you mix the hot with the mild the blend is magical. My only knock on them is that their chips are mediocre at best. Normally I judge a place based on their chips, but in this case the rest of the food makes up for the lack of chip flavor.

If you are in old town Scottsdale with a yen for mex or if you just want a quick take out check it Julios Too!

Ok food but the service is horrific. Disinterested counter staff made for interesting watching during our meal. Watched staff at counter put customers on phone on hold to count his tip money. Ridiculous. Where is the manager?
One of the best places to eat if you like Mexican. Food. Delicious free chips and salsa. My favorite is the jalape√±o cream cheese chicken chimmy conga and the cheese enchiladas are just the best

I am not a huge fan of Mexican food because I have dietary restrictions. However Julio's too has amazing food! The staff is so kind and very accompanying to my special orders. The food is always perfect, and I definitely think it is worth every penny!!

The guy who answers the phone and runs the counter here is a complete jackass with absolutely no customer service skills whatsoever. He is rude, condescending and dismissive. Three times now in three separate occasions he has talked me out of ordering take out stating ridiculously  long wait times. I like the food here but this guy has talked me out of dining in or ordering take out for the last time. I will not go back. Try Valle Luna instead.

Literally just ordered a Togo bean burrito & rice for $6.50 and I come home to eat it and there are hairs... plural ....hairs in my burrito. I manage a restaurant. I know stuff happens. It does. And I constantly make sure when accidents happen customers are comp'd/made happy at THEIR convenience. The person who answered the phone when I called to let them know @ the disgusting hairs said I could "come in for a refund ". Well I ordered to go because I'm out and about and busy today. Why not credit back my card right now because I did not eat one single bite of that hair laced burrito? I need to inconvenience myself because your cooks aren't clean and put hair in my food? DISGUSTING - Disappointed & honestly it is the easiest order ever and you put hairs.... multiple in it. Not my job to come all the way back so you can make my order right.
The food was great. The staff was happy and gracious. Out of all the places I ate in my trip to AZ this was in the top ten. Simple good food.

We went to Julio's last weekend for the first time. It was Saturday night, so it was pretty busy. We ended up getting a table in the bar. While our server was nice, we got basically no attention at all and had to flag down other servers and the manager to place our order, get refills, and pay our bill. Not impressed with that at all. 

Our food on the other hand, was very good. We had a very tasty selection of salsas, a stuffed chicken quesadilla, and beef fajitas. All of our selections were flavorful and exactly what we would have expected.

So despite some unimpressive service, I do believe we will go back to Julio's and give it a second chance.

I was bummed when they closed the original Julio's on Indian School. Anyway, I finally went in here recently to discover it's not just take out - they actually have tables and lower prices - awesome Mexican food!

Been coming here for years. Please know the Julio's on Tatum isn't owned by the same wonderful people as the one on camelback. There a difference in food and service. Don't waste time in going to the one on Tatum. We eat at least 2-3 times a week when we're in Arizona. Best Mexican food around!!! Great staff and wonderful owners!!
I eat here just about every weekend before work. Everything i get is great, especially the beef mini chimis. And The people that work there are always super friendly!
Good, fast and inexpensive Mexican food.
Awesome, local restaurant with solid food at a great time. The staff here is fantastic. Have been there for years and are very friendly. Julio's is a long time classic.

Horrible. The only reason for two stars is because the staff is nice and the food did not make me throw up (yet). Bland glop. Poor quality food. Sugary tomato sauce on the enchilada. Bland glop is the best I can say. Hubs had pork that was fatty and bland. I had enchilada that was weirdly sweet and gloppy and bland. Gross. Never again.

Do yourself a favor and get the Carne Asada dinner plate ($9). Here is what it includes:

-two carne Asada tacos the size of Texas
-a huge plate of beans and rice that could feed a family
-fresh tortilla chips with salsa fo freeee
-guac (not extra like chipotle!) and sour cream

*also they have $2 Margs if you want to turn up. 

The fajitas and chimichanga are also bomb.com. My dad actually was like why did u spend so much money on food and was shocked two entres cost less than $20. Gotta love AZ food prices

Meh.  Not bad, just kind of bland.

We've been here a couple times. The portions a big but the quality is mediocre.  There are plenty of Mexican restaurants in the area where you can get just as much food but with more flavor.

I used to work near here and we got take out a lot. 

My favorites: spinach enchiladas, green corn tamale, chicken mini chimis ( they come with a green chile cream cheese dip, OMG). 

I loved their tex mex spin, not authentic Mexican, mind you, but tasty. 

I can't speak to the service, I rarely went in to pick up, even... I'm one of those crafty people who can get others to do that, lol. 

I liked it though.

Julio's Too is the take out counterpart to Julio G's, which is a very consistent 4 stars. This take out side has more of a concession stand vibe, but also has a few tables should you want to order something and eat it there without getting the full experience next door. 

I really love Julio G's Pollo Diablo, so I ordered that to go. We also got a cheese quesadilla and French fries... yes I know. Why would you ever get fries from a Mexican restaurant? Well as expected, they weren't so great. Not worth it even if you think it will cure your craving. The cheese quesadilla was fine and the pollo diablo was good, but just not quite as good as the version served next door. Of course, being takeout, some of the effect is lost once you finally get home and dig in, not to mention the warmth. This is not Julio Too's fault though, that's just take out 101. 

We got a bag to fill with chips and some salsa as well. Crispy but definitely not as warm or fresh like the sit down version of Julio's. Overall, if you are craving Julio's but need to get take out, this is a nice easy set up to get your food to go. Otherwise, I recommend just popping next door for the full experience!

This place is amazing! There is not one item that I did not like. 
We can here with the entire family. They set us up outside and constantly checked on us to make sure we were taken care of. Everyone was extremely nice and courteous. 
If you are in the area try this place out. You will not be disappointed.

Today was our first experience at the Restaurant.
 We knew that it would be a home run when we were greeted by Ron the manager.  We told him that we were first time customers. He spent at least ten minutes at our table suggesting different dishes on the menu.  So we would be ready for Bill our server.
Who was spot on.

We also met Don an old timer at the restaurant.

Great dining experience, everyone is so friendly. It is like a neighborhood hangout. 
From the girl who delivered our chips and salsa. To the girl who delivered the shot of Tequila. 

We will definitely be back to see Bill and the gang.

Very surprised to see negative reviews.
Great Mexican food and drinks. The tortilla soup is amazing!  We really like tortilla soup and they have one of the best ones we've ever tasted. They rest of our food was delicious too.
Terrible customer service.  The manager lacks customer service skills and does not know how to speak to customers.  I've been a customer for 18yrs. I will not be

Best green corn tamales around. Great for takeout - small indoor and patio seating for dining in. Super casual ambiance, fantastic lunch specials, extremely good food and beyond reasonable prices. Fresh hot chips are always included with your order and beer/margaritas are available here as well.
I understand they do a large amount of catering and have always wowed customers with exceptional service.
This location had been in the heart of Old Town for as long as I can recall and I've never been disappointed. A must for anyone in the area.

For local fast food style Mexican, Julio's is not bad. The chips and salsa were fresh, but a bit greasy. The fajita salad was good, with decent chicken, and a fried tortilla bowl. The tamale was huge, not the best I've had, but definitely edible. However the flan was horrible - very hard and spongey, but I wasn't expecting too much from fast food. I mean, it's certainly not healthy or authentic Mexican but it's a step up from Taco Bell.

Solid take out option in old town.   Salsa is great and the chips are really nice.  I generally do not go in for the hard shell tacos but at this joint it is worth the extra calories.  If planning to host a game or a party, this is a good option. 

The open at 11 so games that start on Sundays have a disconnect with timing food and football.
Ordered take out last night. I got chicken fajitas and a kids meal for my little one. They give you a bunch of chips and salsa to go and the food was amazing  can't wait to dine in sometime!

I used to have this anorexic friend.  She would join us girls for dinner sometimes.  She would never order anything of course, and when the food would come she would squirm in her seat, roll her eyes and say, "Are you seriously going to eat that?". When I took the lid off my Julio's Too take out, I had a flash back of my anorexic friend and I thought, "I'm not sure this time.". 

I'm from Texas.  I know TexMex and I love it.  No offense, to the other Yelpers who have used the term, but this is not TexMex.  This is more like a Mexi-Mess!  I ordered the chili relleno and green chili corn tamale which was presented in a foil tin mixed with refried beans and rice.  I'll give them credit for the beans and rice.  That was good, but the rest...hmmmm.  The chili relleno was drowned in a glob of greasy cheese.  I'm not trying to say, that the chili relleno is the healthy choice.  It's breaded and sometimes fried.  It is never soggy or submerged in goo...unless you order from Julio's Too.  As for the green chili tamale.  In Texas, tamales are much smaller.  The corn (or maize as they say) is much more understated allowing the filling to really stand out.  This tamale was like a men's size 12 corn shoe with a little bit if cheese and green chili inside.  It was also, encased in a tomb of cheese that I had to dig through before I finally found the tamale.

I won't go in to the salsa.  The other Yelpers got it right.  

Now, I do like the location, the vibe and the service.  I would ride my bike over there for chips and guacamole with friends.  They have a convenience store selection of beverages and a nice patio, which merit an extra star.

I'm not trying to be a jerk with this review, but this is just what I think.

First time here--glad we came!  Free chips and salsa (always a great start to a Mexican meal!).  Hubby and I split the chicken fajitas, which were very tasty!  Good-sized portion with lots of red bell peppers, which we like. Served with side of rice and beans, guac, sour cream, and pico de gallo.  We each ate our fill and still had enough for a take-home 'fajita burrito' :D

Pretty good Mexican food. It's nice that they provide free chips & salsa before your meal, even though it's a casual counter service taco shop. Spinach enchilada makes a nice vegetarian choice. Generous portions & affordable prices. Friendly, prompt service. Fine, fine place to grab a quick bite but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
Refused to serve family of 10 that drove 15 miles because of the stupid super bowl? You get one star, never coming back...

Good Fresh authentic Mexican food....good prices, Great service....first time here and I will be coming back for sure.....and you get free fresh Chips with every order!!!! Great customer service also!!!

I ask what there isn't to like about this particular Julio's Too? For my entire adolescence I searched and searched for a tex-mex style restaurant in my hometown area... but alas found nothing. It wasn't until aught nine that I discovered this magnificent shrine to tasteful eats. 

Family owned and operated, Julio's provides a warm and friendly environment for the casual diner. The menu is simple yet diverse with plate combinations and creations that are not so easy to find in the sonoran style valley. Looking for  recommendation? Try the Green Chile Relleno plate with a side of love from full timer Steve Rosa. Want  a burrito, well they come in size BIG at Julio's and full of all kinds of fresh ingredients. Need I mention how delicious the FREE chips and salsa are with every meal purchased? And with a handful of good friends the restaurant can quickly turn into a wonderfully amusing adventure into the land great food. All in all, I highly recommend stopping by and not just getting a meal, but maybe making a friend or two at the four stool bar section... I know I have!

xo,
Josie
The wait time was long and the staff wasn't very accommodating. the food is decent though.

Eh, not bad, not great! Not a fan of Mexican food anyway unless it is authentic and I am at Gallo Blanco, Frank and Lupe's, or Barrio Cafe. However, that said, this place is not so bad. Cheap and lots of food. When in Scottsdale and you are desperate for a late dinner after visiting the bar scene check it out. I liked their sit down restaurant once upon a time but they closed their doors. This is what's left. It reminds me of a school lunch cafeteria in a way. lol! Hey I ate here last night with my guy and you know what? I actually really liked the Chili Rellenos and their sauces. I am very picky about salsas and sauces from all the Mexican restaurants I worked at over the years. Their hot sauce is really good.

Two words: Fat Mac. I get why Mac was eating Chimichangas so much. Before coming to Julio's I never had Chimichangas, and wow, I totes get why Mac had them all the time. They are delicious, along with every single thing on the Julio's menu.

The people there are the polite incarnate. They would probably have a funeral for a bird or something. Probably one they don't even know like a raven, or even a pigeon - the rats of the sky. More importantly, whenever I go to have Julio's I have such a good time with their food. The first time I went with a real homie and I got the "Pollo Magnifico." Good doesn't quite capture it. My heart skipped so many beats I developed a heart murmur. 

It has a bit of a retro vibe too. It's like if Pulp Fiction was shot within a Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale flair. Except for the busier times, say the weekends, you can always get a seat and your food quite fast. 

Every other time after that was a bad experience, not because of Julio's, they were always perfect, but because I tried to introduce possible love interests to this place. I guess there were other things going on that made those relationships not work, but the fait accompli in my mind was that they didn't like Julio's. I mean just because we had dinner somewhere else before why can't you get another snack? You gotta always have room for Julio's.

Through breakups, the woes of relationships, and the bliss of love, Julio's is gonna have your back and always be delish. Stay up fam. Get in there and get a Chimichanga.
